list_definition.definition: a specially-made or specially-shaped hole or set of holes into which something is fitted

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We’ll need to have a new electric socket fitted into the wall for the television plug.

list_ex_of_english: Most modern homes, even of the humblest kind, are built with space in the kitchen for a refrigerator and are provided with suitable electric sockets.
My second question concerns the problem of harmonising plugs and sockets.
Their eyes appeared to be sunken in their sockets.
The resources used via context switching are socket connections for downloading pages and local storage for programs.
Twenty-two desks will be equipped, at a cost of £40 per desk, with three sockets to which an electric typewriter, table lamp and tape recorder can be connected.
All other wall sockets have to be imported.
As subsection (2) stands, a local authority, not being a highway authority, may not erect pylons or construct sockets in the highway without the consent of the highway authority.
The eye-sockets of tyrannosaurs are positioned so that the eyes would point forward, giving them binocular vision slightly better than that of modern hawks.
